intro: Cojoba glabra, commonly known as the slender sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, tolerating saline conditions and sandy soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cojoba glabra is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to coastal environments.
